tutorial.title: Dynamic Comments Section
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to use JavaScript to add comments dynamically to a webpage

executableContent.instructions:
In this project, you'll use your knowledge of Dynamic Webpages to build a photo-sharing website's comment section functionality.

First, take a minute to browse the provided JavaScript function declarations. You'll implement each function to enable the commenting functionality. 

First, let's tackle the `createEnclosingDiv()` function. This function will create and return the "wrapper" `<div>` element that will eventually house the avatar and comment text.

1. At the top of the `createEnclosingDiv()` function body, use the appropriate JavaScript function to create a `<div>` element and store it in a variable named `enclosingDiv`. 
2. Then, have the function return the `enclosingDiv`.

executableContent.instructions:
We also need to create the element to house the comment's text. Let's work on implementing the `createText()` function, which will be similar to the `createAvatar()` function that we just wrote. 

1. First, use JavaScript to create a `<span>` element and store it in a variable named `newText`.
2. Next, use JavaScript to add the CSS Class "text" to the element stored in the `newText` variable. 
3. Then, set the element's `innerText` to the value passed through the `text` parameter. 
4. Finally, have the `createText` function return the finished `<span>` element.

executableContent.instructions:
To enhance the user experience, let's clear the input fields once a comment has been added. 

1. First, after the `createText()` function, declare a function named `resetFields()` that takes no parameters. 
2. Within the function body, use the appropriate JavaScript function to target the "initials" `<input>` element by its ID (`#initials` ) and set its `value` to an empty string. 
3. Then, repeat the same, but this time for the "comment text" `<input>` element, which has the ID `#commentText`.
